Accident Investigation

Detailed analysis of previous accident and incident data can inform how to make your workplace safer.

Common Causes

Injuries, ill health and incidents can have multiple causes. The immediate cause may be a human or technical failure, but these are commonly caused by failures in management control.

Accident Prevention

When an injury, work-related illness or incident occurs you should do everything possible to discover the underlying cause to prevent it from happening in the future.

Other Reasons

In addition to identify the cause there are other reasons to investigate accidents and incidents.

Ways to Prevent Accidents

  • Collect information to report to the enforcing authority
  • Collect information needed for an insurance claim or legal proceedings
  • Quantify the cost of accidents for the business
  • Generate statistics to track performance

Remember

If you only investigate as far as the immediate causes, there’s a much higher likelihood that it will happen again.

Indentify the Root Cause

Investigation is not about attributing blame, it’s about identifying the root cause to prevent a reoccurrence.
